title: QUESTIONMAN2022
author: QUESTIONMAN2022
content: Hi All,What is the MOST SECURE Desktop Wallet for Stellar Lumens?I am OLD SCHOOL - I only have experience with CORE DESKTOP WALLETS, like Bitcoin Core, Litecoin Core etc. These are the only type of wallets that I trust, because they are the first crypto QT-wallets to be created and they have stood the test of time.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: I'm not saying it secure since desktop wallets are mostly depend on how you practise good security within how you use your own device. But you can try to use Solar Wallet, it listed on the Stellar website, https://stellar.org/lumens/wallets.That wallet link is: https://solarwallet.io/

comments.author: QUESTIONMAN2022
comments.body: Quote from: vv181 on May 19, 2022, 09:38:24 AMI'm not saying it secure since desktop wallets are mostly depend on how you practise good security within how you use your own device. But you can try to use Solar Wallet, it listed on the Stellar website, https://stellar.org/lumens/wallets.That wallet link is: https://solarwallet.io/Thanks for the reply.I saw this recently, directly on the Stellar website, but I still just want to get more "public opinion" on these wallets.Because I am "Old School", I DO NOT trust all these flashy modern Apps that can easily install on a mobile device and use a QR-code. My "GUT FEELING" tells me that some of these modern mobile wallets have security issues in their design.I prefer the OLD STYLE Desktop wallets that have GITHUB Releases.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: The wallet is also open-sourced, you can see it on https://github.com/satoshipay/solar.I personally never use a desktop wallet for Stellar, but I do use Albedo, and it's so far so good. I don't see any critical vulnerability when I use that web wallet.If you really want to be extremely careful and secure, choosing a hardware wallet is a surely convenient option.

comments.body: Quote from: QUESTIONMAN2022 on May 19, 2022, 09:31:11 AMHi All,What is the MOST SECURE Desktop Wallet for Stellar Lumens?I am OLD SCHOOL - I only have experience with CORE DESKTOP WALLETS, like Bitcoin Core, Litecoin Core etc. These are the only type of wallets that I trust, because they are the first crypto QT-wallets to be created and they have stood the test of time.Hello mate, I believe there are plenty of good and secure Stellar wallets for desktop users in the market, I can recommend Exodus wallet or Atomic wallet so far its good, and no reported untoward incidents since the time they were introduced, and currently Im using it, Atomic Wallet to be exact, but if you can afford you better buy a hardware wallet like Trezor, Ledger, Keepkey, Sugi, etc. because it was offered the best security compared to any wallet in existence.

comments.author: QUESTIONMAN2022
comments.body: It looks like Solar Wallet might be the best choice.The question is - what wallet do the Developers use? They have to use a CORE WALLET to do updates.Also, I like the Core wallets, because you can limit DUST ATTACKS through COIN CONTROL.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: Quote from: QUESTIONMAN2022 on May 20, 2022, 04:19:58 PMwhat wallet do the Developers use?It varies.Quote from: QUESTIONMAN2022 on May 20, 2022, 04:19:58 PMThey have to use a CORE WALLET to do updates.They didn't, wallet is only a small part of the ecosystem.Quote from: QUESTIONMAN2022 on May 20, 2022, 04:19:58 PMAlso, I like the Core wallets, because you can limit DUST ATTACKS through COIN CONTROL.Stellar didn't use the UTXO transaction model but an account-based approach, just like ETH. So there is no such thing as coin control.
